pr_title: Fix retrieval of null valued primitive property from dynamic realm

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to call refresh. It should be up to date when opened.
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.author: rorbech

replies.bodyText: Hmm, I don't like that. The underlying read transactions should not be shared between Realm and DynamicRealm. It indicates a bigger problem we need to look into. Probably some caching going wrong somewhere 😕
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Yes. A dynamic realm with the same configuration was already setup. Sorry.
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.bodyText: This seems to impact more than just null values, so we should have unit tests for all the data types.
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Implemented tests for null values for all types, but I would assume all-non null values to be sufficiently test by existing tests. Or what are you missing specifically?
replies.author: rorbech

replies.bodyText: No, those tests should be fine
replies.author: cmelchior

timeline.bodyText: The fix seems to indicate the bug impacted all primitive types. We should have tests for all of them instead of just boolean.
timeline.author: cmelchior

timeline.message: Fix retrieval of null valued primitive property from dynamic realm
Fix retrieval of null valued primitive property from dynamic realm
Testing retrieval of null values for all types

timeline.bodyText: These tests do not seem related in a test named getNullableFields Lists can never be null and I hope that adding null is tested elsewhere, if not, it should probably be in its own test?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: The issue was that we could not return null values for nullable fields from a dynamic realm. I thought it would be safest to also included a check of retrieving a null value from a list from a dynamic realm. I could try to find another place for the test...or update the name of the test to getNullForNullables ... ?
replies.author: rorbech

timeline.bodyText: all of these should be tested below?
timeline.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: Yes. I was just asserting that they were actually null when retrieved from the typed realm.
replies.author: rorbech
